page.title: 19ASHURSTWOOD
page.content: In 1981, the population of this village was 1,440. The main developments in the village have been since 1945 but all development is strictly monitored as the village is located in the High Weald Area of Out- standing Beauty. The area between Ash- urstwood and East Grinstead is called a "strategic gap". There is to be no development in this area unless a very good reason is offered.The council has taken this course of action in an attempt to "protect and enhance" the identity of the village. Only infilling and development of individual houses will be considered by the council and at present no sites have been proposed for development.
